text:
I have an AMD GPU on a windows device with WSL2. Has anyone tried to run AMDGPU.jl on wsl2? If so, what are the necessary components to be installed?

Are there any other ways to use an AMD GPU without WSL2 on windows? Is there a device agnostic binding available, that trades off a bit on performance, but can still be used?

text: No, and I don't think it'll happen for a while (a few years). AMD is focused on their upcoming Linux-based supercomputers, which is where the grant money is.

elements.text: No, and I don't think it'll happen for a while (a few years). AMD is focused on their upcoming Linux-based supercomputers, which is where the grant money is.

text: The issue is that AMD's amdgpu.ko Linux driver is amazingly complicated (just like the CUDA driver), making porting very costly, and is quite Linux-specific because the Linux kernel team is against merging code that's only intended to support out-of-tree (aka proprietary) users, like WSL2.

text: You might be able to do GPU passthrough (so Windows doesn't have any access to the device), but that's not guaranteed to work.
